lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Added to such fears is the fact that no developed nation has suffered a major quake since the far-reaching changes in the last two decades which have bound the global economy into a complex, fragile, interdependent financial network.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: It's difficult to put a figure on it, but the impact on all world markets would be considerable," Brian Waterhouse, a banking expert at brokerage James Capel in Tokyo, told Reuters.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Japan would need huge amounts of money over a long period to rebuild, which would block out developing nation creditors from existing capital resources, the bankers said.
